javadoc:
Generic Metadata table.  Subclasses should provided implementations for the actual
 tables.

methods.name: <init>
methods.comment:
Creates a new generic CLI metadata table.  This is intended to be called by a subclass
 metadata table during its creation.

params.name: reader
params.comment: A reader that is used to read the table.

params.name: metadataStream
params.comment: The metadata stream that the table lives in.

params.name: tableType
params.comment: The type of table to create.

methods.javadoc:
Gets this table's table type.
@return This table's table type.
methods.name: getTableType

methods.javadoc:
Gets the number of rows in this table.
 
 return The number of rows in this table.
methods.name: getNumRows
methods.comment:
Gets the number of rows in this table.
 
 return The number of rows in this table.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the size in bytes of a row in this table.
 
 return The size in bytes of a row in this table.
methods.name: getRowSize
methods.comment:
Gets the size in bytes of a row in this table.
 
 return The size in bytes of a row in this table.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the size in bytes of this table.
@return The size in bytes of this table.
methods.name: getTableSize
methods.comment: Gets the size in bytes of this table.

return.comment: The size in bytes of this table.

methods.name: getRow
methods.comment:
Gets the row at the given index.
 
 NOTE: Per ISO/IEC 23271:2012(E) III.1.9, Row indices start from 1, while heap/stream indices start from 0.

params.name: rowIndex
params.comment: The index of the row to get (starting at 1).

throws.comment: if the row index is invalid.

return.comment: The row at the given index.

methods.javadoc:
Gets the data type of a row in this table.
@return The data type of a row in this table.
methods.name: getRowDataType
methods.comment: Gets the data type of a row in this table.

return.comment: The data type of a row in this table.

name: CliAbstractTable
comment:
Generic Metadata table.  Subclasses should provided implementations for the actual
 tables.
